description.narrative: The aim of this project is to send an experts mission to a poor suburb of Cape Town Philippi in South Africa in the field of horticulture.Philippi has high unemployment rates and a relatively floating non-coherent population that lies within Greater Philippi; a district estimated to be home for some 800,000 people. The area, only two kilometres from Cape Town International Airport, used to be the horticultural produce provider for Cape Town.Two experts of the Centre for the Promotion of Imports from Developing Countries (CBI) will be assigned to do more profound investigations as to the relevant angles or potential business leads for Dutch private sector, in horticulture specifically, but also in a broader perspective such as water usage, energy efficiency and food production and distribution chain.The Western Cape Department of Agriculture has great interest in the development as Philippi is one of their focal areas for agricultural development as well in the context of food security as for economic development of livelihood and emerging farmers.The Philippi farmers have no experience in working in intensive undercover horticulture; consequently choosing for a technically sophisticated level of greenhouse to realize this intensive horticulture would not be wise. The proposition is to do a step by step approach and learn undercover horticulture from the beginning.The conclusion of a Wageningen University/LEI analysis made in February 2012 is that there is a market for medium technology. So, starting with low technology, a growth part in the context of business development scenarios towards medium technology based solutions may be feasible.
